p.strong: The mission of the Monticello Community Schools, a district striving for educational excellence, is to prepare students through challenging experiences, to be caring, productive, creative citizens who will be life-long learners.

article.class: post-25959 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail category-homepage-announcement entry

div.p: Welcome visitors to the NEW Monticello Community School District webpage! We hope you will enjoy and continue to use our new school district website. We have been working on this project for about 18 months. We have sought input from Monticello patrons, parents, students and staff members about how to improve this website. You will[Read More]

article.class: post-26558 post type-post status-publish format-standard category-carpenter-news category-high-school-news category-middle-school-news category-news category-shannon-news entry has-post-thumbnail

h4.a: Wash your hands to our school fight song!

h4.span: See the December Timelapse of the new construction!

div.p: The Mission of the Monticello Community Schools, a District striving for educational excellence, is to prepare students through challenging experiences, to be caring, productive, creative citizens who will possess a desire to be life-long learners.
Visit our School Board page to learn more about our School Board, read board policies and minutes, and find the agenda and date for our next board meeting.

Join our Monticello Panther Community as we support our youth:
Band Parents
Booster Club
PTO
Treble Makers

How do I check my grades in PowerSchool?
Who do I talk to about my schedule?
How do I see activity calendars?
When is Spring Break 2020?
When is Prom 2020?
When is Graduation 2020?

When is Spring Break 2020?
When is Prom 2020?
When is Graduation 2020?
How do I check my lunch balance?
How do I pay online?
How do I find the school calendar?

Hello everyone, my name is Dr. Brian Jaeger and I am the proud Superintendent of the Monticello Community School District. If you are new to Monticello let me be the first to welcome you to this amazing community!!! If you have a student that is continuing in our schools then you may already be aware of the opportunities each student in Monticello has to develop academically, socially, and emotionally.

p.br:
Fax: 319-465-4092
711 South Maple Street
Monticello, IA 52310

div.p: The Monticello Community School District is committed to ensuring that all material on this web site is accessible to students, faculty, staff and the general public. If you experience difficulty with the accessibility of any web pages or documents, please contact Curt Tauke at curt.tauke@monticello.k12.ia.us and request our materials in an alternate format.

td.div: Due to COVID-19, no school until the end of the year. All buildings closed. See the link below to access the MCSD Student Resource document with ideas for PK-12 students. Stay Safe!
